Service Details: - Offers qualified low-income learners the opportunity to purchase donated computers at significantly reduced prices - Strives to provide families with the tools that will enable them to achieve their highest potential in the global knowledge-based economy
Eligibility: Computers for Students Eligibility:	In order to qualify for the Low Income Program, applicants must meet the following criteria:- Must be a resident of British Columbia- Must meet current Low Income Cut-off (LICO) standards- Must be enrolled in a skills development, learning or academic program* ​Please note that applications being submitted for anyone under the age of 18 require a parent or legal guardian to provide both proof of income and registration in an academic or skills training program * 	Low-income Cut-off Standards:	Low income status is determined using the Low Income Cut-Off (LICO) Standards as defined by Statistics Canada. Visit http://www.statcan.gc.ca/pub/75f0002m/2009002/tbl/tbl-3-eng.htm to view or download the “Pre-tax Measure” and http://www.statcan.gc.ca/pub/75f0002m/2009002/tbl/tbl-2-eng.htm to view or download the “Post-tax Measure” LICO Standards to verify the current Low Income Cut-Offs.  * Please note that we use the most current information available to determine eligibility *	Proof of Income acceptable forms: 	- Most recent proof of financial assistance from B.C. Employment and Assistance for Persons with Disabilities Act- Most recent proof of financial assistance from Employment Insurance in the form of a benefit statement- Current Notice of Assessment prepared by Revenue CanadaPrograms & Enrollment Proof of Enrollment Acceptable Forms: - Confirmation of enrollment* Please note that Student ID cards will only be accepted from high school students under the age of 18 * Examples of eligible programs include:- Students registered in elementary, secondary or post-secondary institutions- Courses offered through an accredited institution- Enrollment in a skills development, learning or academic program- Night school courses- ESL
Cost: ​Fees include:- $50 for a desktop (with LCD) or - $100 for a laptopWarranties:The computers for 6 months from the date it is dispatched from their officePayments:- Equipment being shipped:  payment by certified cheque or credit card must be received prior to shipping- For pick up* from our Burnaby workshop applicant must bring the following:  proof of British Columbia residency including address (eg. Driver’s License), proof of Low Income Cut-off (eg. most current Notice of Assessment), and proof of verifiable enrollment in a skills development, learning or academic program (eg.
